SEARCH
Package librarySE.managers

Class UserManager

java.lang.Object
librarySE.managers.UserManager
public class UserManager extends Object
Manager responsible for all user-related operations within the library system.

This class follows the Singleton design pattern to ensure that only one instance manages user data throughout the system. It provides thread-safe access to user collections, lookup utilities, persistence control, and user removal logic.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Loading and saving users via UserRepository
  • Registering new users
  • Searching users by email or username
  • Ensuring business constraints when unregistering a user

Thread Safety:

Uses CopyOnWriteArrayList to ensure thread-safe iteration and modification.

Related Use Cases:

  • US1.x — Admin user management
  • US4.2 — Unregister user constraints
  • Notification / Borrowing features requiring email lookup
Author:
Malak

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static UserManager init(UserRepository repo)
      Initializes the singleton UserManager instance. Must be called exactly once during system setup.
      Parameters:
      repo - the repository used for persistence
      Returns:
      the created singleton instance

    • getInstance

      public static UserManager getInstance()
      Returns the active UserManager instance.
      Returns:
      the singleton UserManager
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if init(UserRepository) was not called beforehand

    • findUserByEmail

      public Optional<User> findUserByEmail(String email)
      Looks up a user using their email address. Matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address to search for
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, otherwise empty

    • findUserByUsername

      public Optional<User> findUserByUsername(String username)
      Finds a user by username. Matching is case-sensitive.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to locate
      Returns:
      an Optional user if found; empty otherwise

    • addUser

      public void addUser(User user)
      Registers a new user and persists the updated user list.
      Parameters:
      user - the user to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user object is null

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Returns an immutable snapshot of all users currently stored.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of users

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll()
      Persists the current user list to the repository.

    • unregisterUser

      public void unregisterUser(User user)
      Removes a user from the system, enforcing all business constraints:
      • User must not have the ADMIN role.
      • User must have no unpaid fines.
      • User must have no active (unreturned) borrow records.
      Parameters:
      user - the user to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user reference is null
      IllegalStateException - if any rule is violated
